relevant_findings.neurological: Normal visual acuity, fields, fundoscopy, cranial nerves; however, self-reported weakness with normal testing of bulk, tone, strength, and reflexes
relevant_findings.MRI: Confirmed severe muscular atrophy of musculus quadriceps femoris

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient experienced worsening symptoms during hospital admission with fevers and cough, leading to transient vision loss. After initiation of high-dose prednisone, symptoms improved dramatically within 24 hours.
